settings.name: Temporal resolution for alignment
settings.description: Insert a numeric value to define the temporal resolution to which the movement data will be thinned for alignment. Default is the mean temporal resolution of the data set. Beware of errors by gaps in your data or unsuitable units. See below for possible time units. Also note that too large data sets can run very long or lead to (memorey limit) errors.

settings.name: Unit of your alignment resolution
settings.description: Select the time unit of your selected alignment resolution. This will also be used for average alignment resolution if you do not provide a value above. Default is hours. Note that your data have to encompass at least 10-20 times the duration of the unit. Also large time gaps within or between individual tracks can lead to errors or unexpected behaviour.

settings.name: Speed of animation
settings.description: Insert a numeric value to define the speed at which your animation shall be running. The unit is frames per second, i.e. relates to the data set. Defaults to 25.

settings.name: Map type
settings.description: Select the type of map that you want to use as your animation background. As Open Street meap (osm) is presently having problems, the map will be retreived from 'carto'.

settings.name: Resolution of background map
settings.description: Select the resolution for your background map in the range between 0 and 1. Take into account the extent of your data set (i.e. high resolution is not necessary for far ranging data.) Default 0.2.

settings.name: Track colour option
settings.description: Select how you want to colour your animated tracks.

options.displayText: coloured by other animal or track attribute (define below)

settings.name: Other attribute for track colouring
settings.description: Insert the exact spelling of the other animal or track attribute by which you want to colour your animated tracks. Check the previous App's data overview for available attributes and their spelling. Note that the legend (if you select to show it) will still give the track IDs as names, but colour them by the selected attribute.

settings.name: Track ID legend
settings.description: Select if you want to include a legend to your animation map.

settings.name: Caption
settings.description: Insert a caption text that will be displayed at the bottom of the visualisation window. Typically this is the data reference.

settings.name: Output file format
settings.description: Select an output file format from the below options. The file extension must correspond to a file format known by the available renderers of the system on which the video will be run.

settings.name: Adaption factor for map extent
settings.description: Insert the adaption factor by which to multiply the map extent. Anything between 0.1 and 1 decreases, above 1 increases the extent. By default, the extent of the data is used, i.e. 1.
